long_description:
Use this service to find out about bond loans and rental grants.

A Bond Loan is an interest-free and fee-free loan to cover the rental bond when you move into private rental accommodation.

The loan amount is a maximum of 4 weeks rent and must be repaid.

Bond loans are available to eligible people only.

Bond Loan Plus is an interest-free and fee-free loan to cover the rental bond plus an amount equal to 2 weeks rent for the property you want to rent.

The loan amount is a maximum of 6 weeks rent and must be repaid.

To find out more, talk to your local Housing Service Centre.

A Rental Grant is a one-off grant of 2 weeks rent for people in a housing crisis. It helps pay for the cost of moving into private rental accommodation.

Rental Grants are available to eligible people only.

Check your eligibility
short_description: Use this service to find out about bond loans and rental grants.
coarse-grained_eligibility:
Australian Citizen or Permanent Resident| Have a Bridging Visa and have applied for Permanent Protection Visa (class XA) | Holder of a Temporary Protection Visa (TPV) | Have a Bridging Visa and are being processed for Resolution of Status Visa (subclass 851)
Renter
who_is_eligible:
To be eligible, all of the following conditions must be met:

  • You don’t currently live in the property that you need bond for.
  • You’re an Australian citizen or permanent resident, or have a temporary protection or bridging visa.
  • You don’t own or part-own:
    • a residential property
    • a caravan, mobile home or live-aboard boat permanently connected to household utilities.
  • You have less than $2500 in cash or savings among all the Bond Loan applicants (not including dependents).
  • You don’t have outstanding debts with us.
  • You’re choosing a property where the rent isn’t more than 60% of the total gross weekly income of all applicants.
  • You meet the current income limits:

    • Income eligibility limits are assessed on the total income for a household, not individuals within the household.
what_you_will_need:
You will need to provide for each applicant:

  • proof of income
  • at least 2 types of identification
  • proof of Australian residency status

You will also need to provide details of the rental property.
how_to: Read the Guide to find out about the bond loans and rental grants

service_interaction_name: Apply for a Bond Loan Plus
long_description:
Bond Loan Plus is an interest-free and fee-free loan to cover the rental bond plus an amount equal to 2 weeks rent for the property you want to rent.

The loan amount is a maximum of 6 weeks rent and must be repaid.
short_description: Apply for an interest-free loan to cover the cost of bond and an amount equal to 2 weeks rent to move into a new home
coarse-grained_eligibility:
Australian Citizen or Permanent Resident| Have a Bridging Visa and have applied for Permanent Protection Visa (class XA) | Holder of a Temporary Protection Visa (TPV) | Have a Bridging Visa and are being processed for Resolution of Status Visa (subclass 851)
Renter
who_is_eligible:
• You don’t currently live in the property that you need bond for.
  • You’re an Australian citizen or permanent resident, or have a temporary protection or bridging visa.
  • You don’t own or part-own:
  • - a residential property
  • - a caravan, mobile home or live-aboard boat permanently connected to household utilities.
  • You have less than $2500 in cash or savings among all the Bond Loan applicants (not including dependents).
  • You don’t have outstanding debts with us.
  • You’re choosing a property where the rent isn’t more than 60% of the total gross weekly income of all applicants.
  • You meet the current income limits.
what_you_will_need:
You will need to provide for each applicant:

  • proof of income
  • at least 2 types of identification
  • proof of Australian residency status

You will also need to provide details of the rental property.
how_to:
You can apply for a bond loan or rental grant in any of the following ways:

Online 
1. Complete the online form
2. Submit the online form

Email
1. Complete the application form
2. Scan the completed form and your supporting evidence 
3. Email the form and your supporting evidence to bondloan@hpw.qld.gov.au

Post
1. Complete the application form
2. Scan the completed form and your supporting evidence 
3. Post the form and your supporting evidence to: 
  Bond Loan Statewide Services Team
  PO Box 1120
  Bundaberg QLD 4670

Fax
1. Complete the application form
2. Scan the completed form and your supporting evidence
3. Fax the form and supporting evidence to 1300 762 514

In person
1. Bring your completed application and your supporting evidence to your nearest Housing Service Centre, Queensland Government Agent Program (QGAP) office or Courthouse
You can use the Housing Assist Qld App too. It can be downloaded from Apple, Android and Windows stores.
You can apply for a bond loan and or Rental Grant, check eligibility, apply for a pre-approval, check your balance
and reveal your bond loan repayment barcode on the app.

service_interaction_name: Apply for a bond loan
long_description: A Bond Loan is an interest-free and fee-free loan to cover the rental bond when you move into private rental accommodation.
short_description: Apply for an interest-free loan to cover the cost of bond to move into a new home
coarse-grained_eligibility:
Australian Citizen or Permanent Resident| Have a Bridging Visa and have applied for Permanent Protection Visa (class XA) | Holder of a Temporary Protection Visa (TPV) | Have a Bridging Visa and are being processed for Resolution of Status Visa (subclass 851)
Renter
who_is_eligible:
To be eligible, all of the following conditions must be met:

  • You don’t currently live in the property that you need bond for.
  • You’re an Australian citizen or permanent resident, or have a temporary protection or bridging visa.
  • You don’t own or part-own:
    • a residential property
    • a caravan, mobile home or live-aboard boat permanently connected to household utilities.
  • You have less than $2500 in cash or savings among all the Bond Loan applicants (not including dependents).
  • You don’t have outstanding debts with us.
  • You’re choosing a property where the rent isn’t more than 60% of the total gross weekly income of all applicants.
  • You meet the current income limits:
      • Weekly income

      (before tax)

      Type of household

      $ 1,013

      One adult $ 1,519

      Two adults $ 2,025

      Three adults $ 2,531

      Four adults $ 1,316

      One adult with one dependant $ 1,620

      One adult with two dependants $ 1,924

      One adult with three dependants $ 2,228

      One adult with four dependants $ 1,823

      Two adults with one dependant $ 2,126

      Two adults with two dependants $ 2,430

      Two adults with three dependants $2,734

      Two adults with four dependants

      To calculate income eligibility for household types not listed above, please use the information below:

      First adult: $1,012.56

      Each additional adult $506.28

      Each dependant $303.77

      The total household income limit is then rounded to the nearest dollar.

      Income eligibility limits are assessed on the total income for a household, not individuals within the household.
what_you_will_need:
You will need to provide for each applicant:

  • proof of income
  • at least 2 types of identification
  • proof of Australian residency status

You will also need to provide details of the rental property.
how_to:
You can apply for a bond loan or rental grant in any of the following ways:

Online 
1. Complete the online form
2. Submit the online form

Email
1. Complete the application form
2. Scan the completed form and your supporting evidence 
3. Email the form and your supporting evidence to bondloan@hpw.qld.gov.au

Post
1. Complete the application form
2. Scan the completed form and your supporting evidence 
3. Post the form and your supporting evidence to: 
  Bond Loan Statewide Services Team
  PO Box 1120
  Bundaberg QLD 4670

Fax
1. Complete the application form
2. Scan the completed form and your supporting evidence
3. Fax the form and supporting evidence to 1300 762 514

In person
1. Bring your completed application and your supporting evidence to your nearest Housing Service Centre, Queensland Government Agent Program (QGAP) office or Courthouse

service_interaction_name: Apply for a rental grant
long_description: A Rental Grant is a one-off grant of 2 weeks rent for people in a housing crisis. It helps pay for the cost of moving into private rental accommodation.
short_description: Apply for a grant to pay the first 2 weeks of your rent when moving into a rental property
coarse-grained_eligibility:
Australian Citizen or Permanent Resident| Have a Bridging Visa and have applied for Permanent Protection Visa (class XA) | Holder of a Temporary Protection Visa (TPV) | Have a Bridging Visa and are being processed for Resolution of Status Visa (subclass 851)
Renter
who_is_eligible:
• You don’t currently live in the property that you need bond for.
  • You’re an Australian citizen or permanent resident, or have a temporary protection or bridging visa.
  • You don’t own or part-own:
    • a residential property
    • a caravan, mobile home or live-aboard boat permanently connected to household utilities.
  • You have less than $2500 in cash or savings among all the Bond Loan applicants (not including dependents).
  • You don’t have outstanding debts with us.
  • You’re choosing a property where the rent isn’t more than 60% of the total gross weekly income of all applicants.
  • You meet the current income limits
  • You have not received a Rental Grant before.

Additionally, you must meet at least one of these conditions:

  • You’re leaving either a department-approved centre (e.g. emergency housing, women’s shelter) or housing arranged by an approved centre where you spent more than 28 continuous days and you’re applying for assistance within 3 months of leaving.
  • You’ve been discharged from a correctional facility after serving at least 28 days and you’re applying for assistance within 3 months of your release.
  • You’ve been discharged from a hospital or health facility, including mental health facility, within the last 3 months where you were a resident for at least 28 days.
  • You’ve exited support from a child protection service within the last 3 months where you were a resident for at least 28 days or are still in care.
  • You are currently experiencing domestic and family violence.
  • You’re leaving housing provided by a community-based rent scheme in Queensland to move into private rental housing and applying for assistance within 14 days of leaving.
  • You’re homeless or at risk of becoming homeless.
what_you_will_need:
You will need to provide for each applicant:

  • proof of income
  • at least 2 types of identification
  • proof of Australian residency status

You will also need to provide details of the rental property.

You must also provide documentary evidence that you meet 1 of the following conditions:

  • you stayed more than 28 continuous days in a homelessness service (e.g. emergency housing or a women's shelter), or in accommodation arranged by a homelessness service, and apply for the Rental Grant within 3 months of leaving
  • you have left a correctional facility after staying at least 28 days, and apply for the Rental Grant within 3 months of leaving
  • you have left a hospital or health facility within the last 3 months, stayed there for at least 28 days, and apply for the Rental Grant within 3 months of leaving
  • you are leaving a child protection service
  • you or a member of your household is escaping domestic and family violence
  • you are homeless or at risk of becoming homeless
  • you are leaving a community-based rent scheme in Queensland to move into private rental accommodation, and apply for the rental grant within 14 days of leaving.
how_to:
You can apply for a bond loan or rental grant in any of the following ways:

Online 
1. Complete the online form
2. Submit the online form

Email
1. Complete the application form
2. Scan the completed form and your supporting evidence 
3. Email the form and your supporting evidence to bondloan@hpw.qld.gov.au

Post
1. Complete the application form
2. Scan the completed form and your supporting evidence 
3. Post the form and your supporting evidence to: 
  Bond Loan Statewide Services Team
  PO Box 1120
  Bundaberg QLD 4670

Fax
1. Complete the application form
2. Scan the completed form and your supporting evidence
3. Fax the form and supporting evidence to 1300 762 514

In person
1. Bring your completed application and your supporting evidence to your nearest Housing Service Centre, Queensland Government Agent Program (QGAP) office or Courthouse

service_interaction_name: Find out how to repay your bond loan
long_description:
Use this service to find out how to repay your bond loan.

Your bond loan must be repaid within the loan term you were approved for—18 months, 24 months or 30 months. If you want to, you can pay your bond loan back earlier.
short_description:
Use this service to repay your bond loan.

Your bond loan must be repaid within the loan term you were approved for—18 months, 24 months or 30 months.
who_is_eligible: Anyone with a current bond loan.
what_you_will_need: You will need your bond loan number
how_to:
You can repay your Bond Loan by:
- EasyPay—if you receive an income support payment from Centrelink
- BPay—use phone or internet banking by inputting the BPay Biller Code (747337) and your BPay reference number (15 digit customer reference number) printed on your repayment card
- repayment card—pay at any Australia Post Office or agency
- automatic payments—your bank can set up a transfer directly from your bank account to the department to repay your Bond Loan
- cheque/money order—make cheque/money order payable to the Department of Housing and Public Works. Also include your name and Bond Loan account number in the envelope, and post to:
  Shared Service Agency
  Housing Revenue 
  GPO Box 1210
  BRISBANE QLD 4001

If you don't have your repayment card, you can get your card's barcode and BPay reference number online.

long_description:
The Patient Travel Subsidy Scheme (PTSS) provides financial assistance for patients who are referred to specialist medical services not available at their local public hospital or health facility.

Eligible patients are able to apply for a subsidy to assist with travel and accommodation costs of accessing specialist medical services.

Patients approved for PTSS will receive a subsidy to attend the closest public hospital or health facility where the specialist medical treatment is available. Patients travelling to access private specialist services may be eligible for a subsidy if the service is not available within 50 kilometres of the patient's closest public hospital or health facility.

The Scheme is Queensland Government funded and administered through Queensland Health. It aims to support Queenslanders to access specialist medical treatment wherever they live in the state.
short_description: Apply for financial assistance for travel and accommodation costs to obtain specialist medical services
who_is_eligible:
To qualify for PTSS subsidies you must be:

  • a Queensland resident or a patient with no fixed address
  • eligible for Medicare
  • accessing a specialist medical service that is:
    • recommended as medically necessary by a medical practitioner
    • listed as an essential specialist medical service in the Schedule 1-PTSS Guideline Part A
    • not available within 50km of your nearest public hospital.
what_you_will_need: You need a referral to a specialist medical service that is more than 50km from your local public health facility
how_to: Apply online to register for the scheme | apply offline for travel and accommodation claims
keywords:
Health and wellbeing
Concessions
Disability
Parents and Families
Carers and Community Support
in_person: Queensland public hospital or health facility

service_interaction_name: Find details about the subsidies available for patients and approved escorts who need to travel to access specialist medical services that are not available at their local public hospital or health facility.
long_description:
Patients eligible for PTSS can apply for subsidy payments to assist with the travel and accommodation costs of accessing specialist medical services.

Patients who require assistance when travelling can submit an application for an escort to travel with them.

PTSS subsidies for will be assessed against the PTSS Guideline (PDF).

The PTSS is not intended to cover the full costs associated with patients accessing specialist medical services.

service_interaction_name: Find the Patient Travel Subsidy Scheme (PTSS) forms
long_description:
The Patient Travel Subsidy Scheme (PTSS) forms can be completed online or downloaded as a PDF or Word document.

For more information about how to complete a form, consult the user guide. All forms need to be printed and signed before they are submitted.

If you are unable to download these forms, you can contact your local patient travel office and ask them to email or post you a copy. Alternatively, you can get a copy of these forms from your local hospital or health facility.  Check the contact details for your local health facility or patient travel office.

service_interaction_name: Register for the Patient Travel Subsidy Scheme (PTSS)
long_description: Use this form to register with the Patient Travel Subsidy Scheme (PTSS). If you are already registered with the PTSS and your details have not changed you do not need to re-register.  If your details have changed since you registered, use this form to update them.
short_description: Register for the Patient Travel Subsidy Scheme (PTSS)
who_is_eligible:
To qualify for PTSS subsidies you must be:

  • a Queensland resident or a patient with no fixed address
  • eligible for Medicare
  • accessing a specialist medical service that is:
    • recommended as medically necessary by a medical practitioner
    • listed as an essential specialist medical service in the Schedule 1-PTSS Guideline Part A
    • not available within 50km of your nearest public hospital.
what_you_will_need: You will need your medicare number and expiry date and the card number and expiry date if you have any of the following: a pensioner concession card, a Healthcare card, Department of Veterans Affairs card, or Commonwealth Seniors card.
how_to: Complete the form online.  If you can't complete the form online, you can download the form, print, and then complete the form and lodge with your closest public health facility. If you do not have access to a printer, you can obtain a copy of the form from your closest public health facility.

service_interaction_name: Commence an appointment attendance form for the Patient Travel Subsidy Scheme (PTSS)
long_description: Use this form to confirm that a patient has attended their specialist appointment.  This form needs to be submitted in order for a patient to claim their travel subsidy payment. A new form is needed for each appointment.
short_description: Commence an appointment attendance form for the Patient Travel Subsidy Scheme (PTSS)
who_is_eligible:
To qualify for PTSS subsidies you must be:

  • a Queensland resident or a patient with no fixed address
  • eligible for Medicare
  • accessing a specialist medical service that is:
    • recommended as medically necessary by a medical practitioner
    • listed as an essential specialist medical service in the Schedule 1-PTSS Guideline Part A
    • not available within 50km of your nearest public hospital.
what_you_will_need: You will need the details for the patient and patient's escort if required as well as evidence that the appointment took place, such as medicare receipt or discharge papers.
how_to: Complete the form online, print, and lodge at your closest public health facility. If you can't complete the form online, you can download the form, print, and then complete the form. If you do not have access to a printer, you can obtain a copy of the form from your closest public health facility.
keywords:
Health and wellbeing
Concessions
Disability
Parents and Families
Carers and Community Support
in_person: Queensland public hospital or health facility

what_you_will_need: You will need the details for the patient and patient's escort if required as well as the accommodation facility
how_to: Complete the form online, print, and lodge at your closest public health facility. If you can't complete the form online, you can download the form, print, and then complete the form. long_description:
If you have a disability or condition that restricts your day-to-day living, it can affect your ability to remain living in your home. Sometimes, simple modifications can be the difference between staying at home and moving to specially designed premises. Home Assist Secure pays up to $500 towards critical home maintenance services per household per year. The money goes towards labour costs or modifications relating to your health, safety or security.

It is designed to help eligible people aged over 60, or people who have a disability, to remain in their home rather than moving to a care facility. It is available to both home owners and renters.
short_description:
Home Assist Secure is a service for Queenslanders aged 60 years and over, or people of any age with a disability, who can’t undertake or pay for critical home maintenance without assistance.

This service provides safety-related information, referrals and subsidised assistance.
who_is_eligible:
You must be a Queensland Resident aged 60 years or over, or any age with a disability.

To be eligible you must also be:

  • a Commonwealth Pensioner Concession Card holder
  • unable to complete the work yourself because technical expertise is required or your health and safety would be at risk if you attempted the work yourself
  • unable to make use of alternative forms of assistance, such as through the Commonwealth Home Support Program (CHSP), Queensland Community Care Services, the Department of Veterans' Affairs, family or friends.

Home Assist Secure does not undertake maintenance or repairs that are considered to be the responsibility of the landlord (lessor) under Residential Tenancies legislation or tenancy agreements.
what_you_will_need:
What you’ll need to register your interest:

About 10-15 minutes
Access to your Commonwealth Concession Card
how_to: To register your interest for this assistance, please phone 13QGOV (13 74 68)
keywords:
Seniors
Disability
Homeowners
Concessions
Renters

primary_franchise: Your rights, crime and the law
long_description:
The Registry of Births, Deaths and Marriages are responsible for recording births, deaths, marriages and civil partnerships, changes of name and adoptions in Queensland. The registry also issues certificates for these life events to eligible applicants.

Family historians can also access historical birth, death and marriage records through the family history website.

See births, deaths, and marriages information and find out how to register these life events, apply for a certificate or search your family history.
short_description: The Registry of Births, Deaths and Marriages are responsible for recording births, deaths, marriages and civil partnerships, changes of name and adoptions in Queensland. The registry also issues certificates for these life events to eligible applicants.
who_is_eligible: Anyone can use this service
what_you_will_need: N/A
how_to: Review the detailed information available online for each of the Registry's services.
fees: Detailed fee information is available for each service, some services are free
keywords:
Births, Deaths and Marriages
Parents and families
Rights and law
in_person:
Visit any of the following locations:

  • The Brisbane registry customer service centre at Level 32, 180 Ann Street, Brisbane
  • One of our agents at a Queensland Magistrates Court or Queensland Government Agent Program (QGAP) office (except the Brisbane Magistrates Court)
  • JPs in the Community if you pay online

Bring your completed application form, or printed order receipt (if you paid online), your original proof of ID and other supporting documents (if needed).

service_interaction_name: Apply for a birth certificate (new or replacement)
primary_franchise: Your rights, crime and the law
long_description:
Use this service to apply for a new or replacement Queensland birth certificate or commemorative birth certificate package.

You must register the birth of your child before you can get a birth certificate.

Note: You must pay a fee for this service.
short_description: There are 2 types of birth certificate—standard and commemorative. Only a standard birth certificate can be used for official purposes. You can use your standard birth certificate when applying to government agencies and banks.
coarse-grained_eligibility: Dependent Children  | Born or adopted in Queensland
who_is_eligible: You can apply for a birth certificate if the birth or adoption was registered in Queensland. If you are not the person named on the certificate, you may still be able to apply, check the eligibility and requirements
what_you_will_need:
You will need to:

- Complete, download and print a birth certificate application form.
- Get your proof of ID documents certified by a Justice of the Peace or another authorised person.
- Submit your application form and certified documents to us by post or in person.
how_to:
You can apply for a new or replacement birth certificate in any of the following ways:
- online
- by post
- in person.

Online (Note: It will take you about 10 minutes to fill in the online application form).
1. Answer the questions.
2. Choose how you would like to pay the fee.
3. Review your details.
4. Read the email we send you to find out how to finalise your application.
5. Get your proof of ID documents certified by a Justice of the Peace or another authorised person.
6. Submit your proof of ID by post or in person.

By post
Post your completed application form, or printed order receipt (if you paid online), with your certified documents to:
Registry of Births, Deaths and Marriages PO Box 15188 CITY EAST QLD 4002
We will begin to process your application when we receive your documents.

In person
You can apply for a new or replacement birth certificate by visiting any of the following locations:
- Brisbane registry customer service centre at Level 32, 180 Ann Street, Brisbane
- One of our agents at a Queensland Magistrates Court or Queensland Government Agent Program (QGAP) office (except the Brisbane Magistrates Court).

Bring your completed application form, or printed order receipt (if you paid online), your original proof of ID and other supporting documents (if needed).

If you submit your correctly filled out application at the Brisbane registry customer service centre and the birth has already been registered, the certificate will be given to you immediately, unless registered before 1941.

If the birth was registered before 1941, the certificate will be ready after 2.30pm the next business day. Urgent certificates can be ready in 3 hours (or the next business day if you apply after 1.30pm).

Note: A fee applies if you request an urgent certificate.

Processing timeframes for applications received via post or through one of our agents that are correctly filled out applications that have all the required proof of ID and supporting documents (if needed) are:
- 5 business days for non-urgent certificate applications (average processing time—no additional fee)
- 2 business days for urgent certificate applications (a fee applies).

Please allow extra time for Australia Post to deliver your birth certificate to your address.
keywords:
Births, Deaths and Marriages
Parents and families
Rights and law
in_person:
Visit any of the following locations:

  • The Brisbane registry customer service centre at Level 32, 180 Ann Street, Brisbane
  • One of our agents at a Queensland Magistrates Court or Queensland Government Agent Program (QGAP) office (except the Brisbane Magistrates Court)
  • JPs in the Community if you pay online

Bring your completed application form, or printed order receipt (if you paid online), your original proof of ID and other supporting documents (if needed).

service_interaction_name: Apply for a marriage certificate (new or replacement)
primary_franchise: Your rights, crime and the law
long_description:
Use this service to apply for a new or replacement Queensland marriage certificate or commemorative marriage certificate package.

Your registered celebrant or registered minister of religion must record your marriage with us. We do not automatically send a certificate when a marriage is registered. You need to buy one.

There are 3 types of marriage certificate—standard, commemorative and ceremonial.

Only a standard marriage certificate can be used for official purposes and proof of change of name. You can also use your standard marriage certificate when applying to government agencies and banks.

The ceremonial marriage certificate given to you by your registered celebrant or registered minister of religion is not official. You cannot use it to prove your relationship.

Commemorative marriage certificate packages include a standard marriage certificate.

Note: If you were married outside Queensland, contact the interstate or overseas registering authority to get your certificate.
short_description: Use this service to get a Queensland marriage certificate, a replacement marriage certificate or a commemorative marriage certificate package—if you or the person you are applying for were married (and the marriage registered) in the state.
who_is_eligible: To be eligible for this service you, or the person you are applying for, must have been married (and the marriage registered) in Queensland.
what_you_will_need:
You will need to:

- Complete, download and print a marriage certificate application form.
- Get your proof of ID documents certified by a Justice of the Peace or another authorised person.
- Submit your application form and certified documents to us by post or in person.
how_to:
You can apply for a new or replacement marriage certificate in any of the following ways:
- online
- by post
- in person.

Online (Note: It will take you about 10 minutes to fill in the online application form).
1. Answer the questions.
2. Choose how you would like to pay the fee.
3. Review your details.
4. Read the email we send you to find out how to finalise your application.
5. Get your proof of ID documents certified by a Justice of the Peace or another authorised person.
6. Submit your proof of ID by post or in person.

By post
Post your completed application form, or printed order receipt (if you paid online), with your certified documents to:
Registry of Births, Deaths and Marriages PO Box 15188 CITY EAST QLD 4002
We will begin to process your application when we receive your documents.

In person
You can apply for a new or replacement marriage certificate by visiting any of the following locations:
- Brisbane registry customer service centre at Level 32, 180 Ann Street, Brisbane
- One of our agents at a Queensland Magistrates Court or Queensland Government Agent Program (QGAP) office (except the Brisbane Magistrates Court).

Bring your completed application form, or printed order receipt (if you paid online), your original proof of ID and other supporting documents (if needed).

If you submit your correctly filled out application at the Brisbane registry customer service centre and the marriage has already been registered, the certificate will be given to you immediately, unless registered before 1963.

If the marriage was registered before 1963, the certificate will be ready after 2.30pm the next business day. Urgent certificates ($29.35) can be ready in 3 hours (or the next business day if you apply after 1.30pm).
Note: A fee applies if you request an urgent certificate.

Processing timeframes for applications received via post or through one of our agents that are correctly filled out applications that have all the required proof of ID and supporting documents (if needed) are:
- 5 business days for non-urgent certificate applications (average processing time—no additional fee)
- 2 business days for urgent certificate applications (a fee applies).

Please allow extra time for Australia Post to deliver your birth certificate to your address.

Births, Deaths and Marriages
Parents and families
Rights and law

Bring your completed application form, or printed order receipt (if you paid online), your original proof of ID and other supporting documents (if needed).

service_interaction_name: Apply for a civil partnership certificate (new or replacement)
primary_franchise: Your rights, crime and the law
long_description:
Use this service to apply for a new or replacement Queensland civil partnership certificate, or a commemorative civil partnership certificate package.

We do not automatically send a certificate when a partnership is registered. You need to buy one.

There are 2 types of certificates—standard and commemorative. Only a standard civil partnership certificate can be used for official purposes.

Commemorative civil partnership certificate packages include a standard civil partnership certificate.

Note: If your partnership was registered outside Queensland, contact the interstate or overseas registering authority to get your certificate.
short_description: Use this service to apply for a new or replacement Queensland civil partnership certificate, or a commemorative civil partnership certificate package, if your relationship was registered in Queensland.
who_is_eligible: You can use this service if you, or the person you are applying for, registered a civil partnership in Queensland.
what_you_will_need:
You will need to:

- Complete, download and print a civil partnership certificate application form.
- Get your proof of ID documents certified by a Justice of the Peace or another authorised person.
- Submit your application form and certified documents to us by post or in person.
how_to:
You can apply for a new or replacement civil partnership certificate in any of the following ways:
- online
- by post
- in person.

Online (Note: It will take you about 10 minutes to fill in the online application form).
1. Answer the questions.
2. Choose how you would like to pay the fee.
3. Review your details.
4. Read the email we send you to find out how to finalise your application.
5. Get your proof of ID documents certified by a Justice of the Peace or another authorised person.
6. Submit your proof of ID by post or in person.

By post
Post your completed application form, or printed order receipt (if you paid online), with your certified documents to:
Registry of Births, Deaths and Marriages PO Box 15188 CITY EAST QLD 4002
We will begin to process your application when we receive your documents.

In person
You can apply for a new or replacement civil partnership certificate by visiting any of the following locations:
- Brisbane registry customer service centre at Level 32, 180 Ann Street, Brisbane
- One of our agents at a Queensland Magistrates Court or Queensland Government Agent Program (QGAP) office (except the Brisbane Magistrates Court).

Bring your completed application form, or printed order receipt (if you paid online), your original proof of ID and other supporting documents (if needed).

If you submit your correctly filled out application at the Brisbane registry customer service centre and the civil partnership has already been registered, the certificate will be given to you immediately.

Processing timeframes for applications received via post or through one of our agents that are correctly filled out applications that have all the required proof of ID and supporting documents (if needed) are:
- 5 business days for non-urgent certificate applications (average processing time—no additional fee)
- 2 business days for urgent certificate applications (a fee applies).

Please allow extra time for Australia Post to deliver your birth certificate to your address.
